intro: Notopleura humensis, commonly known as the African moonflower, is a climbing plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its large, showy white flowers that open at night. The plant has palmately lobed leaves and produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. The botanical features of Notopleura humensis make it a distinctive and ecologically important species in its native habitat.
